job_title: EVS AIDE I in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great upper management, communication,training ,pay!
cons: You can only get hired on as a Per diem at first . Per diem employees get a certain amount of hours and then when they run out they’re laid off for 3 months until they get more hours if they did not get a full time position already .

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great training, benefits are great.
cons: day positions are difficult to come by

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The insurance coverage is okay.
cons: Unchecked bullying goes on everywhere in the hospital. If you report bullying to supervisors, it gets worse. The supervisors are afraid of the bullies and do nothing to stop them. I’ve been threatened that I would get “cut”. My car tire was punctured in the parking garage. I just had to quit for my own peace of mind.

job_title: Registered Dietitian in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great coworkers and supportive environment
cons: Cases can be complex and knowledge in a lot of different units in the hospital is a must. Can feel overwhelming at first if not experienced, but definitely grows your knowledge.

review_title: The pension is not with it
job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Las Vegas Valley
pros: Pay, coworkers. Insurance is cheap,
cons: Mandatory overtime, poor schedule, incompetent leadership.

job_title: LVN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Working at Peccole Primary and Quick Care has been great! Everyone is like family there. We have a great team that I always willing to help each other. We have great management, Kathy our supervisor is a great listener and always offer good ideas and feedback. I love it here!
cons: Main hospital gets more perks than outpatient clinic.

review_title: Pension available, but you work for it.
job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Las Vegas, NV
pros: One of the few hospitals I'm aware of that has pretty decently funded pension plan. top earning 36 months are averaged, 30% of that average after vested for five years, increases with seniority for a max of 30 years, can buy more years of vestment. Scheduling is the same week to week. If you work Mon-Weds nights, you will only be required to work those nights and will get the rest of the week off. Per diem pays relatively well compared to cost of living in the city.
cons: Very busy hospital, most trauma cases in the whole city, heavy work loads, no staffing ratio policies. Sometimes supplies aren't as available as they should be, some of the equipment available to the respiratory department isn't as good as it should be. organization of supplies could also use improvement. It's also somewhat difficult to get in touch with providers quickly.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Competitive compensation and outstanding benefits
cons: Policies and procedures are obsolete

job_title: Floater Pharmacist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great pay, ok hours, learning environment
cons: Long shifts, non consistent hours

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Las Vegas Valley
pros: Good learning experience with a lot of variety
cons: No cons that come to mind

review_title: Good place to start a career.
job_title: Computer Technician in Las Vegas, NV
pros: PERS, cheap insurance and more benefits as a Public Employee.
cons: Failure to develop key competencies and behaviors Poor communication and feedback.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: pension that is about it
cons: management, staffing and patient population

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pension, work-life balance, job stability
cons: Most management is lacking and not present. Had experience with a director who was spiteful. I feel if management had a total re-do, we could be superior to any hospital in Vegas.

job_title: Project Manager in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Longevity ,Health Insurance, and Pay.
cons: IT department is a joke. A bunch of Micromanagers. Embarrassingly still on windows 7, Its 2022. Gets hacked all the time. Waste of taxpayer's money on these so called IT security. Its who you know in the IT department. Avoid the IT department at all cost.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good health insurance, good services, took time to train as a new employee
cons: Always understaffed. Can never take breaks as promised

review_title: Not what I expected from UMC
job_title: Admin Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Family Friendly benefits, innovative studies that make your proud and you can meet people from all walks of life.
cons:
If you’re looking for a fair employment opportunity keep looking! Your value isn’t based on what you bring to the table as an employee it is about the opinion of your leadership. Working here is based on surviving your managers power of the pen, not hard work. A frivolous claim can lead to your demise even if invalidated. We have gone from a team to a dictatorship.

Your Assistant Director is unprofessionally friends with the managers and supervisors. Everything you say in private is subject to everyone’s business. HR is not a resource to the staff, they work with the leadership team right, wrong or indifferent. They are fully aware of the inappropriate behavior and relationships in the department, it isn’t a secret. They enable the bad habits. If you complain to HR they tell you to go speak to the perpetrator. You would never send a victim to talk to the aggressor so someone being treated poorly in the workplace should not be advised to go back to speak to an aggressor without support or a mediator.
Thank goodness for the Union, the unprotected are just sitting ducks. This is why good leaders are hard to find in this department. It is also the reason no one wants the job in leadership, not lack of intelligence or know how. It’s the requirement to smother your integrity to keep your job.

Our turn over is horrible, the worst I have ever witnessed in all the years I have worked here. Top leadership blames the staff, it isn’t us. We can’t even maintain good supervisors under the current conditions without them demoting or leaving. Reflecting on when it started and what changed in that time would be a good place to start in finding the core of the problem. 

I am hoping changes can be made so that we can work together and respect is restored. I love UMC but I dislike what has been created.

job_title: Admit Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The Retirement and longevity checks.
cons:
They don’t offer remote positions 
Management doesn’t care about the employees 
Employees including Mgmt need to be drug tested

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Las Vegas, NV
pros: They offer you adequate benefits
cons: Worst pay scale in the area. Too bureaucratic.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good benefits. Good pension there.
cons: If you want a good schedule you must do your time.

review_title: Most people in IT are HOURLY
job_title: Business Intelligence Analyst in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Retirement and health insurance are nice. You don't pay SSI income tax. You also get COLA raises every year. You can gain a ton of experience at UMC for your career elsewhere.
cons: They treat professionals like children. Jobs that are normally salary at other companies are hourly at UMC. You have to clock in and out for your day and you have to clock in and out for lunch. If you clock in and out a minute late, you will get written up.

job_title: Business Intelligence Analyst in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Retirement and health insurance are nice. You don't pay SSI income tax. You also get COLA raises every year. You can gain a ton of experience at UMC for your career elsewhere.
cons: They treat professionals like children. Jobs that are normally salary at other companies are hourly at UMC. You have to clock in and out for your day and you have to clock in and out for lunch. If you clock in and out a minute late, you will get written up.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Retirement and longevity if you have been a long term employee, if not, don't bother. Free insurance(for now) if you're a full time employee. Lots of vacation time, but holidays are included in that accrual. So is your first 16 hours if you call off sick. Equipment is pretty decent here, other techs that work other places say it's best around.
cons: Read the SEIU contract!!! It is awful. Don't waste your money unless you need protection. Radiology mgmt does not follow contractual rules. They make their own rules and if you complain, your subject to bullying and harassment. Patients are not the best, but it's the county hospital, it is what it is.

review_title: Nurses are rude and don't take good care of patients.
job_title: Technician in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The benefits are good. The pay is good. The working environment is ok. The food is good for the most part.
cons: There seems to be culture of clicks at this hospital. The people that have been hear for a long time don't treat the new people well. It took 3'years before I felt comfortable. Very dirty hospital. Pilipino clicks are the worst. You will totally be shut out of activities in some nursing units. There are a lot of problems here between pilipinos and other peoples. Had to take a loan to make payroll not a good sign.

job_title: ER RN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: An overall easy going work environment with supportive staff members and doctors. The acuity is high which gives great work experience, and since UMC has every specialty on call, you see a variety.
cons: The management is fairly new, and constantly comparing us to previous hospitals they have worked at and trying to make changes base on that without considering the impact of the different workflows. In some cases the changes they are making are worse than the existing work flow.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great place to get exposure to a wide variety of surgical procedures.  Staff is knowledgeable and willing to teach if you are willing to learn.
cons: Tensions can run high between management and staff.  While this is a teaching hospital there is not a well defined training program.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Lots of vacation time. Accrual is slow to start but picks up after the first year. Union keeps management from stepping all over you.
cons: Budget is usually tight, but we get the equipment and supplies needed to do our jobs. There's just not a lot for "extras" like at other facilities.

review_title: Lower pay than other facilities  but good benefits.
job_title: Patient Account Specialist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: no social security taxes are deducted.  My supervisor  and the billing manager are very knowledgeable.
cons: employees are in cliques.  Very difficult to advance to higher levels even with credentials.  Too many manual processes.

job_title: Senior Management Analyst in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great benefits, insurance/dental/vision premium covered at 100% for single coverage, PERS retirement 27% of annual salary covered at 100% by employer.
cons: Outdated software in offices, outdated and dirty floors/elevators/paint/etc.., some pretty bad management that seems checked out at times and/or willing to quickly throw employees under the bus to save themselves.

job_title: IT Helpdesk Tech in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pay and Benefits close to the top of the top end for a helpdesk in Las Vegas. Medical, dental, vision, and great retirement.
cons: Training numerous applications and situations with on the job being the training being given causes frustration for tech and user's

review_title: Great place to get your feet wet as a sonographer
job_title: Ultrasound Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: You will gain experience,  Hospital position
cons: Equipment is not up to date. There methods are not organized. leadership is weak

job_title: Phlebotomist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: pros-after 8yrs. with U.M.C. you'll get longevity. on your yearly evaluation that a nice factor.
cons: its micro-manage. that a good feeling.

job_title: in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pay was 16$ hr so it was good for a single person income, not a stressful job and great benefits
cons: Bad management and not enough employees, too manny patients without enough care providers

job_title: Admitting Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: It is union so you make a decent wage.
cons: Bullying is rampant. No steps are taken to curb it. Management is afraid of some of the workers.

job_title: Patient Account Specialist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Working with and assisting people from all over the world. That job allowed me to help people on a daily basis.
cons: I couldn't help everyone, and I did get attached to people who were terminal

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: PERS for retirement, weekly opportunities for continuing education credit and 36 HR work weeks.
cons: Doctor and nurse relations stressed.  Management does not stick up for nurses. All employees have taken a paycut.

job_title: CLA in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The people and after 9 yrs umc became my second family
cons: Great place to work iv learned a lot there and seen a lot

review_title: Provided interpreting services to enhance communication between Patients and Providers.
job_title: Interpreter in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Extremely rewarding opportunities to help the community
cons: Vicarious trauma &  burn out schedules

job_title: Data Specialist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Job security in a volatile economy.
cons: No upward mobility in this company.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Lots of great folks here trying to help a difficult population.
cons: Resources are scarce and priorities are often backwards.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Employee benefits (Healthcare insurance PERS - pension, paid time off, paid Holidays)
cons: Getting through the HR selection process.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: PERS and CAL time union benefits
cons: lowest paid hourly wage for RN's in the valley/ health insurance is awful

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Longevity pay, free insurance, retirement
cons: Leadership goes back on their word, the hospital is all about PR, unsafe nursing acuity requirements

job_title: Clinical Lab Assistant in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great work enviorment! Great  medical/dental  and retirement benefits and 401 K.
cons: Sometimes under staffed, but we managed and did our job right.

job_title: Oncologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: small business owner has freedom and independence
cons: small business owner is overworked and often under payed

job_title: Receptionist in Lubbock, TX
pros: Radiology dept is wonderful and had great Mgmt and work life balance was wonderful
cons: Growth in the dept

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great place to work and get good experience.
cons: Nothing! Great place to work!

job_title: Registered Nurse PICU in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Benefits.  Union. Staff. Physicians. Epic
cons: Schedule. Management. Staffing.  Upper management. Education.

job_title: EVS Aide in Las Vegas, TX
pros: Friendly co-workers in department and some others.
cons: Other departments are sometimes hostile.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Las Vegas, NM
pros: it's a good place to work
cons: There is nothing negative to say

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good benefits and potential for opportunities
cons: The Public Safety Department needs overhauling. Arrogant supervisors and full time workers are not in any way welcoming to newcomers.

job_title: Cath Lab in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good people to work with
cons: Bad worker moral, over worked and underpaid. Unpaid for lunches not taken.
